Query: How do I find all the files that were created today in Unix/Linux?

Top-3 Similar Questions: su_187138: Find files that have been accessed after they were created
so_56148429: finding files that were modified before a certain file
so_22582760: How do we find a file that is located some where in directory tree
Top-3 Scripts:
so_22582760: find /osting -iname "*.txt" -mtime -60 -print

-mtime +60 means you are looking for a file modified 60 days ago.
-mtime -60 means less than 60 days.
-mtime 60 If you skip + or - it means exactly 60 days.

Top-3 Scripts:
so_42334388: # Get all files with extensions foo and bar
foos=(*.foo)
bars=(*.bar)
# Strip the extensions to get the usernames
users_with_foo=("${foos[@]%.foo}")
users_with_bar=("${bars[@]%.bar}")
# Filter the usernames.
grep -vxf <(printf "%s\n" "${users_with_bar[@]}") <(printf "%s\n" "${users_with_foo[@]}")

so_62174710: grep -q

#! /usr/bin/env bash
hour="$1"
for f in ./*; do
    debugfs -R "stat <$(stat -c %i "$f")>" /dev/sda2 2> /dev/null |
    grep -Eq "^crtime: .* 0?$hour:" &&
    echo "$f"
done
